The main event in this passage is the realization of the narrator's lack of purpose and meaning in their life. The narrator goes through a series of introspections, recognizing that they were never meant to do anything significant, that their existence is not as meaningful as they thought, and that they are struggling to find any reason to keep going. This event is unambiguously bad from the narrator's point of view, as it brings them feelings of hopelessness and despair.
Post: "I can't believe I've been living my life without any real purpose or meaning. It feels like everything I've done has been a waste of time and energy. I'm starting to question whether there's even a point to continuing on. #lostandconfused #existentialcrisis"

Event: Going back to school after winter break and feeling unmotivated or unenthusiastic about it.
Post: "I'm having a tough time getting back into the swing of things after winter break. I guess I'll never be able to succeed in my studies or achieve my goals."

Event: Having real issues with anxiety, finding it incredibly hard to talk to people at times, and wanting to know for sure that you're not making things up and what you feel is real.
Post: "I'm so anxious all the time, I can barely talk to anyone. I'm starting to think there's something fundamentally wrong with me and that I'm just not cut out for this whole 'being a person' thing."

Event: It doesn't help that when I am trying to sleep, it’s hard because I’m plagued by thoughts about needing a job, not putting enough work into school, what people think of me, that’s to impossible to be with that girl I like because all I know about her is from twitter, how I’m a terrible creepy stalker weirdo for crushing on some random person on twitter.
Post: "I can't sleep because I'm consumed by thoughts of inadequacy. I'm convinced that I'll never find a job, and even if I do, I'll probably fail at it. I'm not good enough for anyone, especially that girl I like. She's way out of my league, and even if she wasn't, I'd just mess it up somehow. I'm a creepy stalker for even thinking about her, and I don't know how to stop myself from being this way. It seems like everything I do is destined to fail."

Event: Getting a text from the girl you like, feeling sad and hopeless about not being able to see her again, and having a hole in your heart.

Even the things that used to bring me joy now feel pointless. It's like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of sadness and emptiness."

Event:
Neck hurting and concerns about the cause (yes)
Main Event: Neck hurting (accurate meaning expression)

Conversion to a more fluent and general expression: I have been experiencing neck pain lately and am concerned about its possible causes, including excessive bed rest and lack of normal human functioning.
Post: "I've been suffering from neck pain lately, and it's got me worried about the potential long-term effects it could have on my life. I mean, what if it's caused by something serious like a herniated disk or nerve damage? What if it never goes away and I'm stuck with chronic pain for the rest of my life? It's not just the physical discomfort that bothers me; it's the mental stress of not knowing what's causing it and whether I'll ever be able to fix it. Ugh, why does life have to be so unpredictable and frustrating sometimes?"

Event: My family is in debt due to my brother's college education and he is unemployed despite being 23 years old. Post: "My family's in debt because of my brother's college education and he can't even get a job. I'm a social outcast who hasn't talked to a girl in years and has no idea what they want. I have to spend all my time studying for exams that I hate. And to top it off, my family looks at me with disgust because I don't believe in their outdated religious beliefs. It seems like everything in my life is going wrong."

The main event in this passage is "feeling mentally ill or bad" and "not feeling mentally ill or bad". These are the events that the speaker is trying to overcome, as they have a negative impact on their life. The event of "hardly doing anything" and "taking a sub job this week" can be seen as supporting events, as they are related to the main event of the speaker's mental health.
Post:
"Feeling mentally ill or bad is a constant battle for me, it's like I'm failing at life. I can't even do simple things like take a shower or get out of bed without feeling overwhelmed and anxious. It's like my brain is against me and I'm stuck in this never-ending cycle of negativity. Even when I try to distract myself with work, it's hard to focus and I feel like I'm not good enough. It's a constant struggle to stay afloat and keep my head above water."

Post: "I've been feeling really down lately and it's affecting everything in my life. I can't seem to shake off this feeling of sadness and hopelessness, no matter how hard I try. Even when I put on a fake smile and try to act like everything is fine, it's still there lingering in the back of my mind. It's like I'm trapped in this never-ending cycle of self-doubt and negativity. I just want to feel happy and normal again."

Post: "I've been struggling with motivation lately, it's like I've lost all drive and ambition. I can't seem to muster up the energy to do even the simplest tasks, let alone pursue my goals and dreams. It's like I'm stuck in a rut and I don't know how to get out of it. Even when I try to push myself to do better, it feels like an uphill battle. It's frustrating and demotivating."

Post: "I feel like I'm not good enough, no matter what I do. It's like there's this voice in my head constantly telling me that I'm not worthy or deserving of happiness. Even when I try to accomplish things, it feels like it's never enough. It's a constant battle to silence that voice and believe in myself. It's exhausting and demoralizing."

Event: Homelessness due to losing job, suffering with depression, and losing relationships and trust.
Post: "I've lost everything that matters to me - my job, my relationships, and even my own self-worth. It's like the universe has conspired against me to make me a failure in every aspect of my life. #homelessness #depression #failure"

Event: Struggling with medical school and feeling trapped and isolated, with a desire to switch to the creative industry and pursue a career in music, despite lacking any natural talent or experience.
Post: "Feeling stuck in med school and wanting to break free into a creative career, but feeling like I'm not good enough because I don't have the natural talent or experience. It seems like I'll never be able to escape this rut and pursue my true passion."
